page.title: 15STORNOWAY NORTH - LIFESTYLE
page.content: Throughout the town the sound of {Harris Tweed looms}can be heard. The looms are in weaving sheds, often at the back of the house. We interviewed {Mr Macrae}who is a weaver. He has been weaving for forty-six years and gave us the following imformation.Boban wool is used to weave. Once the weaver has finished the tweed it is put to a {woollen mill}and he gets a price for it depending on the type of tweed. Mr Macrae works twelve hours a day from {8.30am to 8.30pm.}But that is just his usual hours; depending on when he works the amount of tweed he makes differs. Weaving is a very expensive business and the hardest part of weaving is the peddling. 75 people weave in Stornoway but that figure will be going up. Tweed has been made for about 100 years. Mr Macrae said that he taught himself to weave.
